title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — On a night where defense and grit defined the pace, one man authored a masterpiece of offensive firepower that defied the very era. Reggie Miller didn’t just score; he detonated, pouring in a colossal 42 points to single-handedly carry the Indiana Pacers to a 94-83 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.

From the opening tip, this was the Reggie Miller Show. While the rest of the Pacers’ starters combined for a paltry 26 points, Miller was a study in relentless efficiency. He sliced through the lane, connected from deep, and was a perfect 12-for-12 from the charity stripe, a testament to his cunning and composure. The Timberwolves, despite a strong 18-point, 14-rebound double-double from Kevin Garnett and 20 points from Stephon Marbury, had no answer for the onslaught.

The game was a defensive slog, but Miller provided the breathtaking exception. Every time Minnesota threatened to close the gap, there was Miller, silencing the crowd with another clutch basket. He wasn't just beating the defense; he was systematically dismantling it, accounting for nearly 45 percent of his team's entire point total.

This was more than a road win; it was a historic individual performance burned into the league's annals. In an 83-point team effort, one player scoring 42 is not just notable—it is Herculean. Miller’s legendary scoring prowess was on full display, a signature night from one of the game’s most potent assassins. He didn't just lead the Pacers to victory; he shouldered them there, leaving no doubt about whose night it truly was.
